TEXT.English: [TAB]Jordan, officially the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan (Arabic: al-Mamlakah al-Urduniyah al-Hashimiyah), is an Arab kingdom in the Middle East, on the East Bank of the Jordan River. Jordan is bordered by Saudi Arabia to the south and east, Iraq to the north-east, Syria to the north, and Israel and Palestine to the west. After the post-World War I division of West Asia by Britain and France, the Emirate of Transjordan was officially recognized by the Council of the League of Nations in 1922. In 1946, Jordan became an independent sovereign state officially known as the Hashemite Kingdom of Transjordan. After capturing the West Bank during the 1948 Arab-Israeli War, Abdullah I took the title King of Jordan. The name of the state was changed to The Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan on 1 December 1948.

TEXT.English: [H1]Abdullah II of Jordan [\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Paraguay[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] xxx1111xx[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Abdullah II ibn al-Hussein is the King of Jordan after he ascended the throne on 7 February 1999 upon the death of his father King Hussein. He is a member of the Hashemite family which has ruled Jordan since 1946 and claims to be descendant of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. Abdullah, was born to Hussein from his second wife, the ethnically British Princess Muna al-Hussein. He was named as crown prince shortly after his birth. The King Hussein transferred the title to his own brother, Hassan, in 1965, only to return it to Abdullah in 1999. He is married to Queen Rania who is of Palestinian origin. In 1993, he assumed command of Jordan's special forces and became a Major General in May 1998.

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. Love truth even if it harms you, and hate lies even if they serve you. These are words of wisdom to live by.
